intro: Aethionema recurvum, commonly known as the rock cabbage, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing perennial that typically forms dense mats of fleshy, succulent leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, adding a delicate touch to rocky or arid landscapes. Aethionema recurvum thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought and poor nutrient conditions. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
